snippet: A Dutch Supreme Court decision related to a 1995 Bosnian War massacre could affect the willingness of nations to supply troops for future United Nations missions.
abstract: Dutch Supreme Court, in a decision that may pose new risks for countries involved in international peacekeeping operations, rules that the Netherlands was responsible for the deaths of three Bosnian Muslim men during 1995 Srebrenica massacre; say Dutch peacekeepers had wrongly ordered them to leave the United Nations compound during incident, which led to their deaths.
lead_paragraph: A Dutch Supreme Court decision related to a 1995 Bosnian War massacre could affect the willingness of nations to supply troops for future United Nations missions.

headline.main: Dutch Peacekeepers Are Found Responsible for Deaths
headline.print_headline: Dutch Peacekeepers Are Found Responsible for Deaths

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
